name: Mestil's Crafty Emissary and Mestil's Crafty Juggernaut: Wizard 27 / PM 10 / Rogue 3
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Mestil's Craft Emissary and Mestil's Craft Juggernaut

The server I usually play is down for the time being, in such times, I like to do some build design.

I am standing the shoulder of a giant for these build drafts (as they say).

These are interesting variations on Grizzled_Dwarflord's classic build, Mestil's Pale Emissary and his new Mestil's Half-Dead Juggernaut build.

And please note I consider both the drafts I have posted as minor variations of Grizzled's excellent builds.

Rather than take fighter for the bonus feats to take epic damage reduction, I've chosen to take rogue for evasion to reduce damage output from stuff like dragon breath, traps, fireballs, call lightnings and damage dealing spells. 

I believe the evasion combined with a high spellcraft score for saves against spells helps increase its 'tank ability' from damage from from nasty spell casters, traps you might accidentally step on, giants throwing rocks at you, and roguish bomb throwers, particularly if lightning reflexes/epic reflexes are also taken.

It also provides a nice vehicle to invest skill points into without cross classing anything, plus our favourite skill UMD. 

The downside is no discipline (so play this in an environment where knockdown immunity is available) and three feats that have to be taken as epic general feats.

I could have min-maxed more and dumped strength further for starting con 17 to add an epic feat but I'm not super keen on the encumbrance problem from low strength builds.

One could even min-max further for level 40 power and go Wizard 28 / PM 10 / Rogue 2 as uncanny dodge is not really necessary in the build, but I've chosen to put a mid build skill dump of rogue and evasion so it plays ok in a single player module. 

Wizard 29 / PM 10 / Rogue 1 with Rogue 1 at level 40 could even work in the right environment for even more level 40 power if you can equip an item with evasion/improved evasion on it. 

There are a few Wizard/PM/Rogue builds in the archives however none go wizard heavy.

Mestil's Crafty Emissary
This is the high Int version of the build. 

If spell resistance is not a problem, then the spell penetration feats can be easily swapped for SF/GSF/ESF: Necromancy.

I've chosen to go detection, crafting and trap heavy rather than stealthy but stealth is a very reasonable variant combined with the small size of the gnome race & its excellent scouting ability.

I've invested in lightning reflexes and epic reflexes which combined with +10 to saves against spells should be able to mitigate some damage despite a low dexterity score. 

HP can be buffed up to 725 odd with +12 cons which looks pretty solid to me.

Mestil's Crafty Juggernaut
This is the high Con version of the build.

Its built more like a tank so I've invested in great fortitude / epic fortitude which again added to +9-10 against spells will mitigate instant death spells/abilities and cleric implosion.

Although one could swap some of it for lightning reflexes/epic reflexes if death immunity items are available. It should be noted death immunity will not protect against implosion. 

It has 650 odd hp which is buffable with +12 cons to just short of 900hp, again looks quite nice.

What is more Your build will have lower AC than grizzled_dwarflord's Mestil's Half-Dead Juggernaut. Wouldn't this spell be a good option to consider?
These builds are Epic Damage Reduction builds with lots of HP and immunity to Critical Attack.  The goal is to get hit and let what is hitting you die on your damage shields (Elemental Shield, Mestil's Acid Sheath and Death Armor whilst bouncing off your EDR and Premonition/Epic Warding.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Iwan, thanks for posting! And that is not a silly question at all.

The AC is kept deliberately low in such builds to take advantage of the damage shield spells mages have.
These are spells such as Mestil's Acid Sheath. 
With a caster level of 26 and Mestil's Acid Sheath active, each time the enemies hit you with melee attacks, they will receive 1d6 + 52 / hit.
So if they hit you 4 times / round, that is over 200 damage dealt to them.
Keeping the AC low helps the enemy hit you.
Even though the enemy hits you more, making the character critical hit immune, sneak attack immune, and with damage reduction from EDR and Epic Warding helps keep the character alive long enough for them to die much faster than you receive damage.

It is a great idea GDL has posted. I have simply posted a variant which has evasion to further reduce damage received from things like fireballs / rocks thrown by giants, rogue class to put the skill points in to class skills, rather than cross class them (costing 2 skill points / point), and added a caster level. Overall it might be a nice variation which might be more survivable.
